page.title: 02A STRANGE STORY
page.content: {MARY MORELANDS GRAVE}__At the end of the 17th Century a woman called Mary Moreland lived in Bellerby with her niece.Soon after her wedding her husband died and Mary hanged herself. So she had to be buried on the boundary line of the village and ignored. Whilst they were carrying her body out of the parish the ladder on which she was being carried broke,40 metres short of the boundary in a field called Marleymire on Richmond Road.Since then the people of Bellerby and people of nearby villages have disputed the boundary of Bellerby. The place where she was buried is marked on the Ordnance Survey map as Mary Moreland's Well.
